column2: ["2 lb. potatoes, boiled and sliced", "1 medium onion (sweet if available), sliced thin", "2 ribs celery, sliced thin", "8 slices bacon fried crisp (save grease)"]
column3: ["Crumble bacon and add to potato, celery and onion mixture; add salt and pepper to taste.", "Add 1 heaping tablespoon flour to bacon grease and stir until smooth.", "Add 1/3 cup vinegar, 2/3 cup sugar and 1 cup water; cook and stir until smooth.", "Add more of vinegar mixture if too thick.", "Taste and add more sugar, water or vinegar to your taste if necessary.", "Add to potato mixture and mix well. Add more salt and pepper to your taste.", "Feeds 4 to 6."]

column2: ["2 c. whipped potatoes", "4 Tbsp. flour", "6 Tbsp. butter or margarine", "1/2 medium onion, chopped (optional)"]
column3: ["Shape about 6 balls of potatoes in palms of hands.", "Roll in flour to cover both sides.", "Heat butter or margarine in skillet over medium heat.", "Brown on both sides."]

column2: ["1 c. self-rising flour", "3 Tbsp. mayonnaise", "1/2 c. milk (whole)"]

column2: ["1 c. flour", "1/2 c. butter", "3 oz. cream cheese, at room temperature"]

column2: ["1 (3 oz.) pkg. cream cheese", "1 stick butter", "1 c. plain flour"]

column2: ["2 c. self-rising flour", "1/4 c. mayonnaise", "1 c. milk (sweet)"]

column2: ["1 slice bread", "1 egg", "butter or margarine"]
column3: ["Butter both sides of the bread. Using a small juice glass or 2-inch round cookie cutter, cut a hole in the center of the bread. Place the bread with the hole, and the hole, in a large skillet. Carefully crack the egg into the hole. Cook over medium heat until done on one side and then flip over and cook on the other side. It is like an over easy egg.", "The hole can be used as toast."]

column2: ["12 to 15 medium potatoes, cooked and mashed as usual", "1 (8 oz.) cream cheese, softened", "1 container French onion dip"]
column3: ["After potatoes are mashed, add cream cheese and dip.", "Put into casserole.", "Dot with butter and sprinkle with paprika.", "Put into oven and heat thoroughly, gently brown on top.", "Can be made day before and reheated in microwave."]

column2: ["5 large carrots", "1 medium onion", "6 c. chicken broth", "2 Tbsp. butter"]
column3: ["Peel and chop carrots and onion.", "Melt butter in saucepan.", "Add carrots and onion.", "Cover; steam and stir for 20 minutes, then add the broth and boil for 45 minutes.", "When tender, blend in mixer along with liquid puree.", "Heat to boiling, then serve.", "Freezes well.", "Makes 4 bowls."]

column2: ["6 slices bread", "butter", "chicken broth"]
column3: ["My mother always made this when we were sick.", "It is an old recipe."]

column2: ["2 c. flour, sifted", "2 (3 oz.) pkg. cream cheese, softened", "1 c. butter, unsalted and softened"]

column2: ["1 large pkg. cream cheese", "2 Tbsp. mayonnaise (use cream cheese, lite, and fat-free mayonnaise)", "2 Tbsp. chopped onion", "1/4 c. bell pepper, diced fine", "1/2 c. grated carrots", "1/2 c. celery, diced fine", "1/2 c. chopped cucumber, salted to taste"]

column2: ["14 Idaho potatoes", "1 1/2 sticks butter", "1 pt. sour cream", "1/3 to 1/2 c. Cheez Whiz (to taste)"]
column3: ["Bake the potatoes at 450\u00b0 for 1 hour and 15 minutes.", "Melt the Cheez Whiz and butter.", "Hollow out the potatoes while still hot and mash insides.", "Add salt and pepper to taste.", "Alternate cheese sauce and sour cream.", "Mix thoroughly and stuff into potato skins. Bake at 400\u00b0 for approximately 20 minutes or until delicately brown."]

column2: ["1 1/2 c. self-rising flour", "2 1/2 Tbsp. mayonnaise", "1/2 c. milk"]

column2: ["2 c. self-rising flour", "1 c. sour cream", "2 sticks butter, melted"]

column2: ["2 c. plain flour", "2 sticks butter", "8 oz. cream cheese"]

column2: ["1 c. flour (self-rising)", "1/2 c. milk", "2 Tbsp. mayonnaise"]

column2: ["1 c. self-rising flour", "1/2 c. milk", "1 egg"]

column2: ["1 (12 oz.) can Diet Coke", "1 c. ketchup", "onion (optional)", "bell pepper (optional)", "boneless chicken breasts"]

column2: ["leftover mashed potatoes", "1 egg", "flour"]

Press down slightly.", "Will slice and cook other side.", "Cook until both sides are golden brown.", "Serve hot, with steaks, mixed grills, eggs and bacon or with hamburgers."]

column2: ["1 pt. mayonnaise", "1 (8 oz.) pkg. cream cheese", "1 medium onion, cut very fine", "4 beef bouillon cubes"]

column2: ["1 c. self-rising flour", "1/2 c. milk", "2 Tbsp. mayonnaise, rounded (not heaping)"]

column2: ["1 c. butter, softened", "1 c. sour cream", "2 c. self-rising flour"]

column2: ["2 sticks butter (not oleo", "1 c. sour cream", "2 c. self-rising flour"]

Put thumbprint in center.", "Put a drop of raspberry jam in thumbprint.", "Bake at 350\u00b0 for 15 to 20 minutes. Sprinkle or sift powdered sugar over after they come out of the oven."]

column2: ["leftover rice", "6 to 8 slices bacon", "onion", "soy sauce"]

column2: ["8 oz. sour cream", "2 c. self-rising flour", "2 sticks butter (no substitute)"]

column2: ["1 egg", "1 slice bread", "1/2 Tbsp. butter"]

column2: ["4 chicken breasts", "1 (8 oz.) pkg. cream cheese", "chopped onion (green ends)", "1 lb. bacon"]

column2: ["2 lb. calf liver, 1/2-inch thick, skinned (cut away gristle)", "flour", "butter", "12 slices good-quality bacon"]

column1: Poulet Moutarde(Don'T Be Put Off By The Title; It'S Easy And Delicious.)

column2: ["1/2 c. butter", "3 oz. cream cheese", "1 c. flour"]

Cook until golden brown on both sides."]

column2: ["1 egg", "bread", "butter, syrup or favorite topping"]

Place each patty on a square of foil.", "On top of each patty, place onion, carrots and potatoes.", "Seal foil around each and place on a baking sheet.", "Bake at 300\u00b0 for 1 hour.", "Serve in foil; add salt and pepper to taste."]

column3: ["Cook the potatoes and carrots in boiling water until tender. Drain. Saute bacon until crisp. Drain on paper towels and crumble. Saute onion and celery until tender.", "Combine potatoes, carrots, onion/celery mixture, bacon and milk in pot. Simmer for 30 minutes.", "May also add cheese as desired.", "Makes about 2 quarts or 8 (1 cup) servings."]

column2: ["1 c. self-rising flour", "1 c. milk or buttermilk", "1 egg"]
column3: ["Blend egg and milk together.", "Slowly beat in flour.", "Fry over medium heat until golden brown.", "If you like fruit in pancakes, add 1/2 cup.", "Good with blueberries, strawberries or apples."]

column2: ["2 lb. carrots, sliced", "1 bell pepper, diced", "1 onion, diced"]
column3: ["Boil carrots in salted water until tender.", "Let cool.", "Add onions and peppers.", "Mix marinade together."]

column2: ["1 (3 oz.) pkg. cream cheese", "1/2 c. butter", "1 c. flour"]
column3: ["Mix with fork.", "Roll in 1-inch balls.", "Press in small tins."]

column2: ["3 to 4 potatoes", "butter or bacon fat", "1 onion, chopped"]
column3: ["Peel and slice potatoes.", "Melt butter or fat in heavy skillet.", "Add potatoes.", "Stir one time, adding more fat if potatoes stick.", "Cover and cook for 10 minutes.", "Uncover, season and cook over high heat for another 10 minutes.", "Turn often now until brown."]

column2: ["4 large potatoes, grated", "1/8 c. grated onion", "2 Tbsp. flour", "1 egg, slightly beaten"]
column3: ["Keep grated potatoes covered with cold water until ready to mix to prevent discoloration.", "Mix all ingredients in a large bowl.", "Spoon into nonstick or lightly oiled skillet and cook as you would regular pancakes.", "Turn cakes when edges become lightly browned.", "Serve warm with applesauce (optional)."]

column2: ["2 c. self-rising flour (I like White Lily)", "1/4 c. butter or shortening", "3/4 c. milk"]
column3: ["Preheat oven to 425\u00b0.", "In a large mixing bowl, cut butter or shortening into flour with fork or pastry blender until crumbly. Stir in milk until just sticking in one ball (sometimes takes less milk).", "Turn onto floured board and knead 10 to 12 times. Roll or press the dough to 3/4-inch thick and cut with biscuit cutters. Place on ungreased cookie sheet and bake 10 to 12 minutes or until lightly browned on top.", "Yields 4 servings."]

column2: ["potatoes (as many as needed)", "melted butter", "garlic salt"]
column3: ["Cut potatoes in half lengthwise.", "Place down in glass pan with melted butter.", "Sprinkle with garlic salt.", "Bake, uncovered, at 350\u00b0 for about 1 hour."]

column2: ["2/3 stick butter", "1 c. converted rice, rinsed and drained", "2 1/2 c. chicken broth"]
column3: ["Melt butter in a pan.", "Add the rice and stir over low heat until the rice is browned.", "(Be careful not to burn the butter.) Add the chicken broth after it has been heated to the boiling point.", "Cover and simmer for 25 minutes.", "Remove from heat and put a double layer of paper towels over the pan, under the lid.", "Let stand for 10 to 15 minutes before serving."]

column2: ["1 3-oz. pkg. cream cheese", "1 c. flour", "1/2 c. butter"]
column3: ["Mix and chill for 1 hour.", "Make 1 inch balls and press into small muffin tins."]

column2: ["1 large can tomatoes", "1 Tbsp. butter", "flour", "1/2 c. milk"]
column3: ["Boil tomatoes and butter.", "Mix the flour and milk.", "Drop flour mixture a spoonful at a time into boiling tomatoes.", "Turn stove down and cook until looks done.", "Add a little more milk and stir."]

column2: ["1 stick soft butter or margarine", "1 (3 oz.) pkg. cream cheese, softened", "1 c. all-purpose flour"]
column3: ["Mix well and chill overnight.", "Roll out to fit pan, prick with fork and bake 8 to 10 minutes in 400\u00b0 oven.", "Fill with favorite filling."]

column2: ["5 to 6 potatoes, peeled and diced", "1 small can chicken broth", "1 small onion, diced fine", "1 qt. milk", "1/4 stick butter"]
column3: ["Cook diced potatoes and onions in chicken broth until tender. Add milk and butter.", "Season to taste with salt and pepper."]

column2: ["1 c. self rising flour", "1/2 c. milk", "2 Tbsp. mayonnaise"]
column3: ["Mix.", "Drop into 6 cup muffin tin, well greased.", "Bake at 425\u00b0 for 12 to 15 minutes."]

column2: ["2 Tbsp. mayonnaise", "1 c. self-rising flour", "1/2 c. milk or buttermilk"]
column3: ["Mix mayonnaise into flour.", "Add milk; pour into 12 greased muffin cups.", "Bake at 450\u00b0 for 20 minutes."]

column2: ["rice", "1 egg", "soy sauce"]
column3: ["Mix 3 or 4 cups of rice with 1 raw egg.", "Add soy sauce to taste."]

column2: ["1 c. sour cream", "1 c. melted butter", "2 c. self-rising flour"]
column3: ["Combine butter and sour cream. Put the flour into a large bowl and pour butter and sour cream into it.", "Stir to mix well. Fill ungreased mini muffin tin with 1 heaping tablespoonful of batter in each cup. Bake 15 minutes at 400\u00b0. Cool for about 3 minutes before removing from pan.", "Good with roast beef or ham in them."]

column2: ["5 to 6 medium potatoes", "2 Tbsp. butter", "2 Tbsp. flour", "2 Tbsp. milk"]
column3: ["Cut into 1-inch pieces and cook until tender.", "Melt butter; mix in flour and milk to make a smooth cream.", "Pour over potatoes and stir gently until covered.", "Salt and pepper to taste.", "Serve immediately."]

column2: ["1 baguette bread", "butter flavored cooking spray", "1/4 c. shredded cheddar cheese"]
column3: ["Cut bread into 1/2 inch slices.", "Coat both sides with cooking spray and place on a baking sheet.", "Broil four inches from heat for one minute or until cheese melts."]

column2: ["2 c. self-rising flour", "4 rounded Tbsp. mayonnaise", "1 c. milk (sweet or buttermilk)"]
column3: ["Mix.", "Cook", "in greased muffin tins at 400\u00b0 until brown, about 20 minutes."]

column2: ["1 loaf unsliced French bread", "1 pkg. Good Seasons garlic and cheese dressing mix", "1 stick butter or margarine"]
column3: ["Trim all crust from bread and slice in half lengthwise.", "Mix butter and dressing mix.", "Spread on all sides of bread.", "Bake on cookie sheet at 350\u00b0 for 10 to 15 minutes.", "Watch as it burns easily."]

column2: ["1 c. flour", "1 medium to large egg", "1 (49 1/2 oz.) can chicken broth"]
column3: ["Cut egg in flour until small pea size.", "Bring chicken broth to a boil.", "Slowly stir in rivals in hot broth.", "Turn heat down to low; simmer until thickened and rivals are done.", "Serves 6 to 8."]

column2: ["6 potatoes", "1 1/2 sticks butter", "2 slices bread"]
column3: ["Cook and mash potatoes.", "Put in a bowl, making a hole, with potatoes on all sides.", "Melt 1 stick of butter and pour into hole."]

column2: ["4 c. chicken broth", "4 medium potatoes, diced", "2 celery ribs, diced", "1 onion, diced", "1 Tbsp. butter", "4 c. milk", "1 egg, beaten", "1 c. flour"]
column3: ["Bring chicken broth to a boil in a large pot.", "Add potatoes, celery and onions. Cook until potatoes are tender. Add butter and milk.", "Bring to a simmer and add salt and pepper to taste.", "In a small bowl, stir beaten egg into the flour.", "Stir until a grainy mixture. Sprinkle small amounts at a time into the soup and continue stirring.", "Cook for 15 minutes."]

column2: ["3 large pkg. cream cheese", "1 lb. bacon, fried crisply and crumbled", "grated onion (1 medium is usually enough)"]
column3: ["Combine cheese, bacon and onion.", "Make into a ball.", "Roll in parsley, if desired."]

column2: ["3 or 4 slices bacon", "2 slices loaf bread, broken into small pieces", "1 can stewed tomatoes"]
column3: ["Fry the bacon.", "In the bacon drippings, fry the pieces of loaf bread.", "Add stewed tomatoes.", "Pour into casserole dish.", "Crumble bacon on top.", "Bake at 350\u00b0 for 25 to 30 minutes.", "Good to serve with vegetables."]

column2: ["1 lb. bacon slices, cut in half", "1 loaf thin sliced bread, crust removed", "1 (8 oz.) cream cheese, softened"]
column3: ["Spread cream cheese on bread slice.", "Cut into thirds and roll each piece in bacon slice.", "Secure with toothpicks.", "Freeze.", "Bake at 400\u00b0 for about 30 minutes."]

column2: ["1 c. self-rising flour", "3 heaping Tbsp. mayonnaise", "1 egg", "1/2 c. milk"]
column3: ["Mix all ingredients.", "Bake in greased muffin tins at 425\u00b0 for 10 to 15 minutes or until brown."]

column2: ["1 1/2 sticks butter, softened", "3 oz. cream cheese", "2 c. plain flour"]
column3: ["Mix together and spread in baking dish.", "Reserve some for top crust, if desired."]

column2: ["1 small pkg. cream cheese", "1/4 lb. butter or margarine", "1 c. flour"]
column3: ["Cream the cream cheese and butter or margarine until smooth. Blend in flour.", "Divide into 24 balls.", "Put one in each tin (muffin), pressing against side to line tin evenly."]

column2: ["2 c. self-rising flour", "1 c. milk", "3 Tbsp. mayonnaise"]
column3: ["Mix together and pour into a muffin tin. Bake at 400\u00b0 for about 10 minutes or until browned."]

column2: ["1 (4 oz.) pkg. cream cheese", "3/4 stick real butter", "1 c. flour"]
column3: ["Mix thoroughly with a fork, form into 24 equal balls and press into small muffin pans."]

column2: ["hot dogs (amount of your choice)", "ketchup", "mustard", "onion, chopped"]
column3: ["Split hot dogs down the middle halfway.", "Mix ketchup, mustard and onion together.", "Stuff hot dogs with mixture.", "Bake at 350\u00b0 until brown.", "Makes a great party or snack dish."]

column2: ["1/2 lb. butter", "1 c. sour cream", "2 c. sifted self-rising flour"]
column3: ["Soften butter. Mix with sour cream.", "Add flour.", "Bake in small muffin tins at 350\u00b0 for 25 to 30 minutes.", "Makes exactly 24. Freeze leftovers.", "Fill muffin tins full."]

column2: ["24 oz. frozen shredded potatoes", "2 c. rich milk", "1 c. half and half", "1 cube butter"]
column3: ["Put milk, half and half, butter, salt and pepper in pan.", "Let come to a boil.", "Put in the softened potatoes and let it come to a boil again.", "It should be thick.", "Add some Parmesan cheese to taste.", "Bake in a 325\u00b0 oven for 45 minutes or until brown."]

column2: ["2 c. self-rising flour", "1 c. butter (room temperature)", "1 c. sour cream"]
column3: ["Sift and measure flour. Cut butter into flour with pastry blender. Mix in sour cream. Mix well and drop into greased muffin pans. Bake at 400\u00b0 for 10 to 12 minutes. Makes about 45 small biscuits."]

column2: ["egg", "sliced bread", "butter"]
column3: ["Spread butter on both sides of the bread.", "Cut 1 1/2 to 2-inch hole in center of bread.", "Place bread and cut out center in heated skillet.", "Drop egg in center of bread.", "When browned, flip over and cook until desired doneness."]

column2: ["2 c. self-rising flour", "1 c. milk", "6 Tbls. mayonnaise"]
column3: ["Combine all ingredients together. Fill muffin tins, bake at 400\u00b0 until brown. Makes approximately 1 dozen."]

column2: ["2 c. self-rising flour", "1 c. sour cream", "2 sticks butter"]
column3: ["Mix and cook in small muffin pans at 400\u00b0 to 425\u00b0 for about 10 minutes."]

column2: ["1 medium size cucumber, peel, grate and drain", "1 (3 oz.) pkg. cream cheese", "1/2 c. mayonnaise", "1 Tbsp. grated onion"]
column3: ["Drain", "cucumber", "between paper towels.\tMix ingredients together; chill for 30 minutes."]

column2: ["2 c. self-rising flour", "3 Tbsp. mayonnaise", "1 c. milk"]
column3: ["Stir together; pour into muffin tins (lightly greased).", "Bake for 10 minutes at 450\u00b0.", "Makes 1 dozen."]

column2: ["2 sticks butter (no substitute)", "1 (8 oz.) carton sour cream", "2 c. self-rising flour, unsifted"]
column3: ["Preheat oven to 350\u00b0.", "Melt butter in large saucepan.", "Add sour cream and flour; mix.", "Drop batter into miniature ungreased muffin tins.", "Fill to top.", "Bake 25 minutes.", "Makes 24 small biscuits rolls."]

column2: ["1 c. plain low-fat yogurt", "1/2 c. mayonnaise", "1/4 c. onion, chopped fine", "2 Tbsp. soy sauce"]
column3: ["Blend all together and chill before serving."]

column2: ["1 beaten egg", "2 Tbsp. milk", "1 c. flour"]
column3: ["Mix and let stand 10 minutes. Roll out and let stand 20 minutes. Cut and let dry for 2 hours.", "Makes 3 cups."]

column2: ["2 Tbsp. cream cheese", "1 to 3 tsp. diced cucumber, strawberries or oranges", "2 slices bread"]
column3: ["In a small bowl, mix the cream cheese with a fork until it's creamy.", "You may need to add a few drops of milk to make it creamy.", "Mix in the cucumbers (or fruit).", "Smooth the paste onto two slices of bread and fit them together.", "Use your favorite cookie cutters to make fun sandwich shapes."]

column2: ["1 c. flour", "1/2 c. milk", "2 Tbsp. mayonnaise"]
column3: ["Combine flour, milk and mayonnaise in bowl; mix well.", "Fill greased muffin cups.", "Bake at 450\u00b0 for 15 minutes or until golden brown.", "Yields 6 servings."]

column2: ["6 chicken breasts (skinless)", "1 1/2 bottles hot sauce", "3 sticks butter, melted"]
column3: ["Deep fry chicken until lightly brown.", "Remove meat and pour hot sauce and butter over chicken.", "Eat."]

column2: ["5 to 6 medium to large potatoes", "2 to 3 slices bacon", "1 medium onion", "half and half", "milk", "2 beef bouillon cubes"]
column3: ["Cube potatoes.", "Cook with beef bouillon cubes until done.", "Fry bacon.", "Saute onion in drippings.", "Drain.", "Crumble bacon into potatoes when done.", "Thicken with half and half and some milk."]

column2: ["1/2 c. butter", "1 (3 oz.) cream cheese", "1 c. flour"]
column3: ["Mix all as pastry; roll into small", "balls.", "Press", "into small muffin pans with finger."]

column2: ["1 large cucumber", "1 (8 oz.) pkg. cream cheese", "1/4 c. onion, finely chopped", "1/4 c. mayonnaise"]
column3: ["Grate peeled cucumber, sprinkle with salt, and allow to drain for 30 minutes.", "Soften cream cheese.", "Mix ingredients and refrigerate.", "Best when spread on Swedish rye bread."]

column2: ["2 to 3 pkg. boneless chicken breasts", "flour", "egg"]
column3: ["Cut chicken into pieces (roughly 2 to 3 pieces per breast half). Dip each piece into beaten egg and then into flour two times.", "Fry in deep fat fryer or wok, approximately 20 minutes. Fry several pieces at one time.", "Set aside in a large container with a tight lid."]

column2: ["2 c. self-rising flour", "1 c. milk", "4 Tbsp. (heaping) mayonnaise"]
column3: ["Sift flour in a bowl and add the mayonnaise and the milk, stirring well.", "Grease a muffin tin and fill about 1/2 to 3/4 full of the dough in each cup.", "Bake in preheated oven at 350\u00b0 to 375\u00b0 (according to your oven) until brown (about 20 minutes).", "Makes about 1 dozen."]

column2: ["2 c. flour", "1 c. chicken broth", "1 beaten egg"]
column3: ["In a large mixing bowl, put about 2 cups of flour.", "Make a well in center of flour.", "Pour in 1 cup hot broth, mixing with a fork as you pour.", "Stir egg into flour-broth mixture.", "Work with fingers until a hole stays in dough when you punch your finger into the dough.", "Add more flour, if needed.", "Roll very thin and cut into strips.", "Break strips into 3-inch pieces and drop into boiling chicken broth.", "Cook until tender."]

column2: ["1 (8 oz.) cream cheese", "1/2 c. mayonnaise", "1 medium pod garlic (use garlic press)", "1 small piece onion (use garlic press)"]
column3: ["Mix and blend all ingredients.", "Cover and refrigerate at least two hours."]

column2: ["1/2 lb. butter", "1 c. sour cream", "3 c. sifted flour"]
column3: ["Mix ingredients with a dough blender.", "Dough will be soft. Refrigerate overnight or for several hours.", "Divide dough into 3 portions."]

column2: ["1 egg", "1 tsp. butter", "1 Tbsp. milk or water"]
column3: ["Cooking Time is 45 to 60 seconds"]

column2: ["3 oz. cream cheese", "1/2 c. butter", "1 c. flour, sifted"]
column3: ["Cream the butter and cream cheese.", "Add flour and mix well. Shape into 24 balls.", "Refrigerate for 20 minutes."]

column2: ["1 c. self-rising flour", "2 Tbsp. mayonnaise", "1/2 c. whole milk"]
column3: ["Stir well until mixed.", "Spoon into well-greased muffin pan. Bake at 400\u00b0 for 15 minutes.", "Makes 6."]

column2: ["6 c. flour", "1 lb. butter, softened", "1 lb. cream cheese, softened"]
column3: ["Cream together by hand.", "Roll out small portions at a time as thin as possible.", "Cut into squares.", "Apply filling of choice and roll up jelly roll fashion.", "Brush top with beaten egg.", "Bake at 375\u00b0 until lightly brown."]

column2: ["6 large unpeeled potatoes, sliced thin", "1 large onion, sliced thin", "4 Tbsp. butter", "4 Tbsp. flour", "2 c. milk"]
column3: ["Layer potatoes and onions in greased 9 x 13-inch baking dish. Mix butter, flour and milk together.", "Cook over low heat until thickened.", "Salt and pepper to taste.", "Pour over potatoes and onions.", "Bake at 350\u00b0 for 1 to 1 1/2 hours or until vegetables are done.", "Can add leftover such as diced ham, smoked sausage, whole kernel corn, green peas or cooked carrots."]

column2: ["1 lb. asparagus, cut into 1-inch pieces and tough ends discarded", "2 (14 1/2 oz.) cans chicken broth", "1 small onion, chopped", "1 Tbsp. flour", "1 Tbsp. butter", "1 tsp. dried summer savory", "sour cream or plain yogurt (optional)"]
column3: ["Melt butter in medium saucepan over medium heat.", "Add onion and cook until tender, about 8 minutes, stirring occasionally. Add flour and stir 2 minutes.", "Gradually add chicken broth and bring to a boil.", "Reduce heat.", "Add asparagus and summer savory and simmer until asparagus is tender, about 25 minutes.", "Cool slightly and drain asparagus, reserving liquid."]

column2: ["1 (3 oz.) pkg. cream cheese", "1/2 c. butter or margarine", "1 c. flour"]
column3: ["Blend ingredients into dough.", "Place in bowl and chill for 1 hour.", "Roll into 1-inch balls.", "Using tins with 1 dozen spaces, place one ball in each mold of tart tin.", "With thumb, mold dough into shape of little shell."]

column2: ["2/3 c. mayonnaise", "1/3 c. salsa", "1 1/2 lb. boneless, skinless chicken breasts, cut into strips"]
column3: ["In large bowl, combine mayonnaise and salsa.", "Set aside 6 tablespoons.", "Add chicken strips to remaining mixture and toss well.", "Let stand for 30 minutes.", "Grill chicken 5-inches from heat, turning once, for 4 minutes or until tender.", "Serve with remaining 6 tablespoons of mixture.", "Makes 6 to 8 appetizer servings."]

column2: ["1 can (10 3/4 oz) condensed cheddar cheese soup", "2 tbsp sour cream or plain yogurt", "1/2 tsp Dijon - style mustard", "1 c cooked broccoli flowerets", "4 hot baked potatoes, slit"]
column3: ["In medium saucepan mix soup sour cream, mustard and broccoli. Over medium heat, heat through, stirring occasionally.", "Serve over potatoes.", "If desired, garnish with red pepper."]

column2: ["1 lb. soft butter or margarine", "12 oz. cream cheese", "4 c. flour"]
column3: ["Mix well with blender or hands until soft ball forms."]

column2: ["2 sticks butter, softened", "2 c. self-rising flour", "8 oz. carton sour cream"]
column3: ["Combine butter and flour; stir in sour cream.", "Drop by tablespoons into greased miniature muffin tins.", "Bake at 400\u00b0 for 15 minutes.", "Yields 36 rolls."]

column2: ["1/2 c. butter or other shortening", "1 c. flour", "1 beaten egg"]
column3: ["Cut shortening into flour as in making pastry; add egg and mix well.", "Spread in greased 9 x 13-inch pan.", "Bake in moderate oven (350\u00b0) for 15 minutes."]

column2: ["1 c. flour", "1/4 c. mayonnaise", "1/2 c. milk"]
column3: ["Mix flour and milk and add mayonnaise.", "Mixture will be thin. Pour into muffin tins which have been well-greased.", "Bake at 375\u00b0 for 15 to 20 minutes or until well browned.", "If any is left over, wrap in foil and freeze."]

column2: ["1 (8 oz.) c. sour cream", "1 c. flour", "1/2 stick butter, melted"]
column3: ["Mix all ingredients together.", "Spoon into a muffin pan.", "Bake at 400\u00b0 until brown.", "Makes 8 biscuits."]

column2: ["2 small potatoes", "1 onion", "1 tsp. butter", "1/4 tsp. Mrs. Dash"]
column3: ["Wash potatoes well.", "Slice thin with peel left on.", "Slice onion thin.", "Place in a microwave dish, covered.", "Cook 6 minutes on High.", "Let casserole set 2 minutes.", "Use more potatoes and onions for a larger dish."]

column2: ["6 or 7 medium potatoes", "5 Tbsp. flour", "2 Tbsp. butter", "2 c. milk", "1 jar Cheez Whiz (16 oz.)"]
column3: ["Peel and slice potatoes.", "In large boiler, boil potatoes until fork-tender (do not overcook).", "Drain and pour into a 13 x 9-inch baking dish.", "In saucepan, melt butter.", "Stir in flour and milk; heat over medium heat.", "Add cheese; heat until melted.", "Pour over potatoes, covering well.", "Bake at 350\u00b0 for 30 to 35 minutes."]

column2: ["3 Tbsp. butter", "4 chicken breasts", "2 Tbsp. flour", "1 c. chicken broth", "1/2 c. milk", "2 Tbsp. Dijon mustard"]
column3: ["Melt butter in a skillet, add breasts and cook until lightly brown (but done).", "Remove chicken.", "Stir in flour and cook for 1 minute.", "Add broth and milk.", "Stir and cook until thickens and bubbles.", "Stir in mustard.", "Return chicken.", "Cover and heat 10 minutes.", "Serve with rice."]

column2: ["2 sticks butter", "8 oz. cream cheese", "2 c. all-purpose flour"]
column3: ["Soften butter and cream cheese.", "Mix all of the ingredients and chill in the refrigerator after making dough into 2 balls. After dough is chilled, roll out and spread 2/3 strawberry preserves.", "Sprinkle on raisins and walnuts.", "Bake at 350\u00b0 for 20 minutes."]

column2: ["2 c. self-rising flour", "1 (8 oz.) container sour cream", "1 stick Land O Lakes butter"]
column3: ["Combine flour with sour cream.", "Melt butter and pour into flour and sour cream mixture.", "Fold mixture together; will be moist.", "Sprinkle flour on mixture to help in rolling into biscuits.", "Roll into small balls and place in mini muffin pan. After preheating oven at 425\u00b0, bake for approximately 10 minutes. Yields 16 mini biscuits."]

column2: ["2 lb. carrots", "1 bell pepper", "1 medium onion"]
column3: ["Slice and cook carrots in salted water.", "When tender, drain and cool.", "Arrange in layers with sliced pepper and onion.", "Cover with sauce and marinate overnight in covered dish in refrigerator."]

column2: ["1 (8 oz.) pkg. cream cheese, softened", "1 Tbsp. milk", "2 Tbsp. Kraft Miracle French dressing", "4 Tbsp. ketchup", "1 Tbsp. onion"]
column3: ["Mix all ingredients in a blender or with a Mixmaster until creamy.", "If it is too thick, add a little milk.", "The Kraft Miracle French dressing is the secret to this recipe."]

column2: ["6 medium potatoes, peeled and quartered (2 lb.)", "1 (8 oz.) pkg. cream cheese, softened", "1 beaten egg", "1/3 c. onion, finely chopped"]
column3: ["Cook potatoes in boiling, salted water until tender; drain. Mash potatoes; add cream cheese, egg, dash of salt and pepper. Beat until smooth.", "Stir in onion.", "If mixture seems dry, add 1 to 2 tablespoons milk.", "Place in buttered quart casserole and bake at 325\u00b0 for 40 to 45 minutes.", "Serves 6 to 8."]

column2: ["1 slice bread (per sandwich)", "1 egg (per sandwich)", "butter"]
column3: ["Squish out", "a flat spot in the middle of bread the size of a half-dollar.", "Tear", "out", "a", "hole the size of a quarter in the middle of flat spot.", "Melt butter in frying pan and cook 1 side of the", "bread in it.", "Take it out; put in more butter and put in the other", "side of the bread.", "Put the egg on top with the yolk in the hole.", "Cook it awhile;", "turn it over and feed it to a hungry kid."]

column2: ["2 envelopes Lipton spring vegetable or onion Cup-a-Soup (instant soup)", "16 oz. sour cream", "10 oz. pkg. frozen chopped spinach, thaw and squeeze dry"]
column3: ["Combine all ingredients. Chill.", "Serve with vegetables or chips.", "Makes 3 cups."]

column2: ["4 chicken breasts, skinned and boned", "1/4 c. soy sauce", "1 c. sour cream"]
column3: ["Place chicken in a greased casserole dish.", "Mix sour cream and soy sauce together.", "Spread over chicken.", "Cover and bake at 350\u00b0 for 1 hour."]

column2: ["6 oz. cream cheese", "6 Tbsp. sour cream", "1 pkg. Good Seasons garlic and herbs salad dressing mix (dry)", "1 burpless cucumber", "1 loaf sandwich bread"]
column3: ["Mix first 2 ingredients together until spreadable consistency. Add package of salad dressing mix."]

column2: ["1 large loaf French bread", "1 to 2 cloves garlic*", "1/4 to 1/2 c. butter or margarine"]
column3: ["Soften butter.", "Crush garlic; work garlic into softened butter.", "Cut loaf of bread into 1 1/2-inch slices cutting through to within 1/2-inch from bottom.", "Spread garlic butter on either side of each slice; press back into shape and spread top and sides with garlic butter.", "Wrap in foil and bake at 400\u00b0 for 10 minutes. Open foil and bake 5 minutes more."]

column2: ["Hidden Valley Ranch dressing mix", "8 oz. cream cheese", "1 c. milk", "1/2 c. sour cream", "3 Tbsp. mayonnaise"]
column3: ["Mix all ingredients together in a bowl; cover and put in refrigerator to cool.", "Great with chips and vegetables.", "Enjoy!"]

column2: ["2 c. flour", "1 c. butter", "6 oz. cream cheese"]
column3: ["Mix all ingredients together and chill 1 hour.", "Roll dough out and cut with 2 1/2-inch cutter to fit in miniature muffin pans."]

column2: ["2 c. self-rising flour", "1 Tbsp. mayonnaise (heaping)", "3/4 to 1 c. milk"]
column3: ["Mix flour and mayonnaise (mix well).", "Pour small amounts of milk to flour mixture.", "Mix until fairly smooth.", "Sprinkle hands with flour.", "Make roll dough with hand, forming a ball.", "Place on a cookie sheet and cook until golden brown."]

column2: ["1 c. unsifted self-rising flour", "1/4 c. butter or margarine", "1/2 c. sour cream"]
column3: ["In bowl with pastry blender, cut the butter into the flour until particles are invisible.", "Add sour cream; with a fork, stir just until flour is moist.", "Drop into miniature muffin tins and bake at 425\u00b0 until brown."]

column2: ["4 to 6 lb. round steak (use plenty of meat)", "1 to 2 lb. carrots, cut up", "1 to 2 lb. celery, cut small", "1 lb. turnips, cut into chunks", "1 large onion, peeled and cooked awhile", "4 to 6 c. potatoes, diced", "2 cans stewed tomatoes (whole)"]
column3: ["Use 4-gallon stew pot. Add 2 gallons of water to start. You may add more water later if you need it. Add all veggies, except potatoes, and cook for 30 minutes on medium heat. Add pre-cooked meat and potatoes; cook another 30 minutes. Add seasoning and simmer until ready to eat."]

column2: ["1 c. melted butter", "1 c. sour cream", "2 c. self-rising flour"]
column3: ["Combine and blend ingredients.", "Mix well.", "Fill ungreased small muffin tins to the top with batter.", "Bake at 350\u00b0 for 25 minutes."]

column2: ["1/2 c. mayonnaise", "1/4 c. mustard", "1/8 c. ketchup", "1 large onion, finely chopped"]
column3: ["In medium-size bowl, combine all ingredients; mix well."]

column2: ["2 lb. carrots peeled and sliced", "1 bell pepper, diced", "1 medium to large onion, diced"]
column3: ["Boil carrots until crisp-tender, then drain.", "While hot, mix with bell pepper and onion."]

column2: ["2 sticks butter, softened", "1 (8 oz.) container sour cream", "2 c. self-rising flour"]
column3: ["Combine all ingredients in a bowl.", "Pour into miniature cupcake tins and bake at 400\u00b0 for 10 minutes."]

column2: ["2 Tbsp. mayonnaise", "1 c. self-rising flour", "1/2 c. milk"]
column3: ["Mix all ingredients and spoon into greased pan.", "Bake in preheated oven at 450\u00b0 until lightly browned."]

column2: ["1 can Eagle Brand milk", "juice from 1 lemon", "1 egg (reserve white for meringue)"]
column3: ["Add to graham cracker crust and top with meringue.", "Bake at 325\u00b0 for 15 minutes or until top is brown.", "Chill and serve."]

column2: ["1 slice bread", "1 egg", "butter or oleo"]
column3: ["Butter bread on both sides.", "Cut a hole in the center of the bread large enough to fit an egg.", "Put buttered bread in a skillet and break an egg in hole of bread; take the hole of the bread and put it in skillet on the side to toast.", "Cook on low heat and flip over to cook on both sides until egg is done.", "Cut bread around egg in pie shapes and use to dip in egg."]

column2: ["2 c. carrots", "1/2 c. chopped celery", "1/2 c. chopped bell pepper", "1/2 c. chopped onion", "1/4 c. garlic", "1 c. diced potatoes"]
column3: ["Mix all ingredients together.", "Cook 30 minutes, then simmer for 5 minutes before adding 1/4 cup skim milk and 1/4 tablespoon flour for thickness.", "You may eat with crackers or cornbread when served."]

column2: ["3 to 4 ripe tomatoes", "1 c. milk", "1/2 c. flour"]
column3: ["Slice tomatoes and fry in butter or oil just covering bottom of frying pan.", "Add flour, stirring to absorb oil.", "Add milk and bring to a boil, stirring constantly.", "Simmer until thick.", "Serve over potatoes, bread, biscuits, etc."]

column2: ["1 c. butter or margarine", "1 (8 oz.) container sour cream", "2 c. self-rising flour"]
column3: ["Combine butter and sour cream; mix until smooth.", "Gradually stir in flour.", "Stir until blended.", "Spoon batter into a 1 3/4-inch muffin pan, filling each with 1 tablespoon of batter. Bake at 350\u00b0 for 25 to 30 minutes.", "Yields 3 dozen."]

column2: ["2 c. self-rising flour", "1 c. butter, melted", "1 (6.5-oz.) pkg. garlic-and-herb spreadable cheese, softened", "1/2 c. sour cream"]
column3: ["Stir together all ingredients just until blended.", "Spoon muffin batter into lightly greased miniature muffin pans, filling to the top.", "Bake at 350\u00b0 for 25 minutes, or until lightly browned."]

column2: ["3 medium potatoes", "1/2 c. carrots", "1/2 c. celery", "1/2 c. onion", "1 can chicken broth"]
column3: ["Cook vegetables in broth until tender, then blend in a blender or use a potato masher to blend vegetables.", "Add 1 pint of low-fat milk or skimmed milk.", "Season to taste with salt and pepper.", "Heat and serve in mugs or bowls.", "Sprinkle no-fat cheese on top."]

column2: ["1 lb. ground beef", "1 onion", "2 small jars medium salsa (mild if you prefer)", "1 1/2 c. rice"]
column3: ["Brown beef and onion in skillet.", "Drain.", "Add salsa.", "Simmer for 5 minutes.", "Meanwhile, prepare rice as directed.", "Serve beef mixture over rice."]

column2: ["1 lb. bacon", "loaf of bread", "8 oz. cream cheese"]
column3: ["Cut crust off bread then cut in rectangular halves.", "Spread cream cheese, then roll.", "Wrap the roll with bacon and secure with toothpick.", "Broil in oven until brown.", "Put oven on broil and put pan on second rack."]

column2: ["apples", "mayonnaise", "crisp chopped bacon or chopped nuts or grated cheese"]
column3: ["Cut apples into chunks.", "Roll in mayonnaise, then roll in crisp chopped bacon or chopped nuts or grated cheese.", "Serve with toothpick."]

column2: ["1/2 lb. bacon", "8 oz. cream cheese", "2 to 3 slices bread"]
column3: ["You will need 12 toothpicks (wooden)."]

column2: ["3 oz. cream cheese", "1 stick butter", "1 c. flour"]
column3: ["Soften cream cheese and butter; blend together.", "Add 1 cup flour; mix together into large ball.", "Chill 1 hour.", "Shape into 2 dozen (1-inch) balls and place in ungreased 1 3/4-inch muffin pans.", "Press dough against bottom and sides."]

column2: ["1 (3 oz.) pkg. cream cheese, room temperature", "1 stick butter, softened", "1 c. flour"]
column3: ["Combine cream cheese and butter, then flour, blending well. Refrigerate for 1 hour.", "Press into ungreased 9-inch pie pan."]

column2: ["1 lb ground beef", "2 tbsp of flour", "1/2 - 3/4 c. milk"]
column3: ["Brown beef, add flour, slowly pour milk over.", "Season to taste. Salt and pepper.", "Add extras to toast (onion, mushrooms)."]

column2: ["1 (8 oz.) pkg. cream cheese", "1 c. milk", "Texas Pete hot sauce to taste"]
column3: ["Let cream cheese soften.", "Beat until creamy.", "Add milk and hot sauce to taste.", "Mix well."]

column2: ["1 (3 oz.) lime Jell-O", "1 (No. 2 1/2) can pears, mashed", "2 (3 oz.) cream cheese", "2 Tbsp. milk", "1/2 pt. Cool Whip"]
column3: ["Pear juice and water make 1 cup.", "Heat and set Jell-O until it starts to thicken.", "Beat cream cheese with milk.", "Add Jell-O to pears.", "Fold in Cool Whip."]

column2: ["1 c. self-rising flour", "2 Tbsp. mayonnaise", "1/2 c. milk"]
column3: ["Mix and drop by teaspoon in small muffin tins. Bake until brown. This mixture will be very soft. Bake at 400\u00b0 for 15 minutes. Yield: 6 to 8 rolls."]

column2: ["2 Tbsp. mayonnaise", "1 c. flour", "1/2 c. milk"]
column3: ["Mix and drop on biscuit sheet or in muffin tins. Bake at 450\u00b0 until brown."]

column2: ["1 stick butter", "1 c. sour cream", "2 c. self-rising flour"]
column3: ["Melt the butter.", "Stir in the sour cream.", "Mix in the flour until moistened.", "Do not overstir, or muffins will be tough.", "Drop mixture into greased muffin tins.", "Bake at 400\u00b0 until brown."]

column2: ["1 (3 oz.) pkg. cream cheese", "1/2 c. butter", "1 c. sifted enriched flour"]
column3: ["Let cheese and butter soften, then beat together and add flour.", "Chill for 1 hour.", "Shape chilled dough into small balls (about 24 to 30).", "Place one ball in each cup of ungreased 1 3/4-inch muffin pans.", "Press ball in center and shape on bottom and sides of cups, forming a shell."]

column2: ["2 c. self-rising flour", "2 sticks melted butter", "1 c. sour cream"]
column3: ["Preheat oven to 400\u00b0.", "Mix all ingredients together.", "Drop into ungreased muffin pans.", "Makes 18 biscuits."]

column2: ["3 ounces cream cheese, softened", "1/2 cup butter, softened", "1 cup all-purpose flour"]
column3: ["Blend cream cheese and butter or margarine. Stir in flour just until blended. Chill about 1 hour. This can be made ahead and chilled for up to 24 hours.", "Preheat oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C).", "Shape dough into 24 one-inch balls and press into ungreased 1 1/2 inch muffin cups (mini-muffin size) to make a shallow shell. Fill with your favorite filling and bake for 20 minutes, or until the crust is light brown."]

column2: ["1 cup self-rising flour", "1/2 cup butter, softened", "1/2 cup sour cream"]
column3: ["Preheat an oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).", "Stir the flour, butter, and sour cream together in a bowl until blended. Scoop the batter into ungreased cupcake tins.", "Bake in the preheated oven until puffed and golden brown, 20 to 30 minutes."]

column2: ["1 cup mayonnaise", "2 tablespoons sriracha hot sauce", "1 lime, juiced"]
column3: ["Stir mayonnaise and sriracha hot sauce together in a bowl until the color is consistent; add lime juice and stir."]

column2: ["3 cups shredded mozzarella cheese", "2 tablespoons mayonnaise", "3 cloves garlic, pressed"]
column3: ["In a medium bowl, stir together the mozzarella cheese, mayonnaise and garlic. Chill until serving."]

column2: ["2 cups self-rising flour", "1 cup milk", "6 tablespoons mayonnaise"]
column3: ["Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).", "In a large bowl, stir together flour, milk, and mayonnaise until just blended. Drop by spoonfuls onto lightly greased baking sheets.", "Bake for 12 minutes in the preheated oven, or until golden brown."]

column2: ["2 potatoes", "2 cups all-purpose flour", "1 egg"]
column3: ["Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Peel potatoes and add to pot. Cook until tender but still firm, about 15 minutes. Drain, cool and mash with a fork or potato masher.", "Combine 1 cup mashed potato, flour and egg in a large bowl. Knead until dough forms a ball. Shape small portions of the dough into long \"snakes\". On a floured surface, cut snakes into half-inch pieces.", "Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil. Drop in gnocchi and cook for 3 to 5 minutes or until gnocchi have risen to the top; drain and serve."]

column2: ["1/4 cup butter", "1/4 cup mayonnaise", "3 cloves garlic, or more to taste", "1 (8 ounce) loaf French bread, sliced"]
column3: ["Preheat grill for medium heat and lightly oil the grate.", "Combine butter, mayonnaise, and garlic in a food processor; blend until smooth. Spread mixture on both sides of French bread slices.", "Toast on the preheated grill until browned and crispy, about 5 minutes per side."]

column2: ["8 large potatoes, peeled and cubed", "4 ounces cream cheese", "1/3 cup butter", "8 ounces sour cream", "1/2 (1 ounce) package dry Ranch-style dressing mix"]
column3: ["Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F ( 175 degrees C).", "Place potatoes in a large pot with enough water to cover. Bring to a boil, and cook until potatoes are tender, about 10 minutes. Drain water, and add cream cheese, butter, sour cream and ranch dressing mix. Mash until creamy using a potato masher or electric mixer. Spread evenly in a large baking dish.", "Bake for 30 minutes in the preheated oven, until the top is golden brown."]

column2: ["2 tablespoons butter", "2 tablespoons all-purpose flour", "1 cup milk"]
column3: ["In a small saucepan over medium heat, melt butter. Add flour and stir until the butter and flour are well combined. Pour in milk, stirring constantly as it thickens. Add more milk depending on desired consistency."]

column2: ["5 potatoes, peeled and sliced", "1 (10.75 ounce) can condensed cheddar cheese soup", "1 1/4 cups milk", "1/4 cup butter, melted"]
column3: ["Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease a 9x9-inch baking dish.", "Layer the potatoes into the prepared baking dish. Mix together the soup, milk, and melted butter in a bowl until thoroughly combined; pour the mixture over the potatoes.", "Bake uncovered in the preheated oven on a lower rack until the potatoes are tender, about 1 hour."]

column2: ["1 pound lean ground beef", "1/2 cup chopped celery", "1/2 cup chopped onion", "1 (14.5 ounce) can stewed tomatoes", "2 (15 ounce) cans spaghetti with sauce"]
column3: ["In a large skillet, brown the beef with the celery and onion until the onion is tender. Add the tomatoes and spaghetti and heat, stirring all together. Serve with garlic bread and a dinner salad if desired. SO easy!"]

column2: ["5 potatoes, peeled and quartered", "3 tablespoons butter", "1/8 cup milk"]
column3: ["Fill a medium size saucepan half full of water, and add a pinch of salt. Bring to a boil. Add potatoes to pot; the water should cover the potatoes. Simmer for 10 minutes, or until potatoes are easily pierced by a fork. Drain.", "Transfer potatoes to a large mixing bowl. Add butter or margarine and milk, and mash with a potato masher. When well mashed, whip for a minute or two with an electric mixer set on medium speed."]

column2: ["16 slices bacon, cut in half", "2 (8 ounce) packages cream cheese", "1 (10 ounce) package pita bread rounds"]
column3: ["Preheat your oven's broiler.", "Open pita rounds, and spread generously with cream cheese on the inside. Replace tops, and use a pizza cutter to slice into 1 inch wide strips. Cut the long strips in half crosswise. Roll up each piece, and wrap with half of a strip of bacon. Secure with toothpicks, and place close together on a baking sheet.", "Broil for 10 minutes in the preheated oven, or until the bacon is cooked through. Use a spatula to remove them to a napkin lined bowl or platter. Remove toothpicks before serving."]

column2: ["1/4 cup butter", "4 slices bread", "1/4 teaspoon garlic powder"]
column3: ["Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Line a baking sheet with aluminum foil.", "Melt butter in a pot over medium heat.", "Cut each bread slice into 16 cubes; add bread cubes and garlic powder to melted butter. Stir to coat. Transfer coated bread cubes to the prepared baking sheet.", "Bake in the preheated oven until crispy, 8 to 10 minutes."]

column2: ["1 cup self-rising flour", "1/2 cup milk", "1/4 cup mayonnaise"]
column3: ["Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Grease 6 large muffin cups.", "Stir flour, milk, and mayonnaise together in a bowl until smooth. Pour flour mixture into prepared muffin cups.", "Bake until golden brown, about 30 minutes ."]

column2: ["8 potatoes", "2 tablespoons butter", "2 cups all-purpose flour"]
column3: ["Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Drop in potatoes and cook until tender but still firm, about 15 minutes. Drain, cool slightly, and peel. Mash potatoes with fork, masher or in ricer. Place in large bowl and make a well in the center. Put butter in well and allow to melt. When mashed potatoes have cooled, knead in enough of the flour to make a soft dough.", "Divide dough into fist-sized portions. On a floured surface, roll each portion into a long rope. Cut the ropes into one-inch pieces. Roll each piece with a fork for a distinctive texture.", "Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil. Drop in gnocchi and cook for 3 to 5 minutes or until they float to the top; drain and serve with tomato sauce."]

column1: Miss Betty'S Super Quick Dinner Rolls
column2: ["1 cup self-rising flour", "1/2 cup milk", "2 tablespoons mayonnaise"]
column3: ["Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). If you are not using a nonstick muffin pan, grease 5 cups of a regular muffin pan.", "In a medium bowl, stir together the flour, milk, and mayonnaise. Spoon into the 5 prepared muffin cups.", "Bake for 15 minutes in the preheated oven, or until nicely puffed and browned."]

column2: ["1 cup all-purpose flour", "1 egg", "2 cups milk"]
column3: ["In a mixing bowl, combine flour, egg, and milk.", "Heat a large skillet or crepe pan over a medium-high heat. Spray the pan with non-stick cooking spray. Pour about 1/3 cup of batter into the pan, lift the pan and turn it by rotating your wrist, spreading a PAPER THIN amount in the pan. Flip the crepe when it starts to bubble. When it is finished cooking, remove it and repeat this process with the remaining batter."]

column2: ["1/2 cup cream cheese", "1 1/2 cups all-purpose flour", "1/2 cup butter"]
column3: ["Soften cream cheese and butter and mix together incorporating flour a little at a time.", "Roll out with a rolling pin between 2 wax papers. Transfer to a 9-inch pie plate and prick with fork before half-baking to prevent shrinkage. Bake for about 10 minutes at 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)."]

column2: ["3 medium potatoes", "2 cups cheddar cheese", "6 tablespoons butter", "milk"]
column3: ["Peel and thinly slice potatoes.", "Coat bottom of 2 quart microwave dish with 3 tablespoons of butter.", "Layer 1/2 of potatoes, 1 cup cheese and 3 tablespoons of butter.", "Add next layer 1/2 potatoes and top with 1 cup cheese.", "Salt and pepper to taste.", "Add a thin layer of milk in bottom of dish, about 1/4\".", "Cover dish with plastic wrap.", "Microwave on high for 10 minutes.", "Let sit 5 minutes before serving."]

column2: ["1 loaf French bread (approx. 16 oz.)", "1/4 cup butter or 1/4 cup margarine, softened", "1 teaspoon garlic powder"]
column3: ["Cut the bread into 8 slices.", "In a small bowl, combine the butter and the garlic powder.", "Spread on one side of each slice of bread.", "Place bread, buttered side up, on a grill over medium heat for 2 minutes or until browned.", "Turn and grill 2 minutes longer or until browned.", "Yield: 8 servings."]

column2: ["1/2 lb butter", "2 cups self rising flour", "1 cup sour cream"]
column3: ["melt butter and mix with flour and sour cream until blended.", "pour mixture into medium muffin tin about 2/3 of the way to allow for rising.", "bake at 350 degrees F until golden brown (about 20 minutes).", "batter will make about 10-12 biscuits."]

column2: ["2 (8 ounce) packages cream cheese, softened", "1/2 cup sour cream", "1 (8 ounce) jar salsa, mild or seasoning salt"]
column3: ["In a medium bowl, beat the cream cheese until smooth; add sour cream.", "Fold in salsa and seasoned salt.", "Store in refrigerator but serve at room temperature.", "Serve with chips or veggies."]

column2: ["6 medium potatoes, peeled and cut into chunks", "2 large carrots, peeled and chopped", "3 garlic cloves, large and finely chopped", "1/2 cup low sodium chicken broth", "1 tablespoon butter"]
column3: ["Combine potatoes and carrots in a large pot and fill with cold water. Bring to a boil and cook 5 minutes.", "Add garlic and reduce heat to simmer until potatoes and carrots are tender, about 35 minutes.", "Drain and keep 1 cup of the cooking liquid.", "Mash the potatoes and carrots with a hand masher.", "Combine chicken broth and butter in a small pan; heat over medium heat until the butter melts.", "Slowly stir broth mixture into the mashed potatoes and carrots.", "If nacessary, add the reserved cooking liquid until the potatoes reach the desired thickness. Server while hot."]

column2: ["2 tablespoons butter", "1 cup onion, minced fine", "1 tablespoon garlic powder", "1 1/2 lbs mushrooms", "1 (10 ounce) package frozen chopped spinach, thawed and drained", "1 (8 ounce) package cream cheese"]
column3: ["In a large skillet or heavy bottomed pan saute the onions and butter on high heat for 2 minutes.", "Add the garlic powder and mushrooms and cook for five minutes, stirring frequently.", "Add the spinach, and continue cooking for about 10 minutes. Stir frequently. The mixture won't get 'dry', but you don't want it to be really wet.", "Add the cream cheese. Mix well until it all dissolves.", "Taste the mixture and add salt and pepper, if desired."]

column2: ["4 chicken breasts", "8 tablespoons ranch dressing", "8 slices bacon", "4 ounces cheddar cheese or 4 ounces colby-monterey jack cheese"]
column3: ["Place chicken breast in a baking dish.", "Spread 2 tablespoons of ranch dressing on each chicken breast.", "Slice bacon to fit chicken breast and layer on top of ranch.", "Bake in oven preheated to 400F on top rack for 35 minutes or until chicken is no longer pink.", "Top with cheese and return to oven for 3-5 minutes or until cheese is melted."]

column2: ["3 tablespoons skim milk", "1 1/2 teaspoons plain fat-free yogurt", "6 tablespoons self-rising flour"]
column3: ["Pre-heat oven 425.", "Mix ingredients and drop onto lightly sprayed cookie sheet.", "Bake for 13-16 minutes."]

column2: ["8 slices whole-grain bread", "8 slices cheddar cheese", "1 medium tomatoes, sliced"]
column3: ["Coat a stovetop ridged grill pan or large nonstick skillet with nonstick cooking spray; heat over medium-high.", "Meanwhile, assemble panini; lay slices of bread on cutting board; top each with a slice of Cheddar.", "Place a tomato slice on top of 4 slices of cheese.", "Assemble to make 4 sandwiches.", "Cook 3-4 minutes, turning once halfway through.", "Press down with a spatula until cheese melts."]

column2: ["2 lbs bacon (regular sliced, not thick)", "2 lbs sea scallops (if very large, cut in half)", "3 tablespoons butter", "1 tablespoon minced garlic", "1/3 cup chicken broth"]
column3: ["Cut bacon strips in half.", "Wrap a piece of bacon around each scallop; secure with toothpick.", "Arrange the wrapped scallops on a baking sheet.", "Broil 5 inches from heat for 3 minutes per side, or until bacon is crisp.", "In small skillet, melt butter; add garlic and saute 1 minute,.", "Add broth and bring to a boil.", "Cook 2 minutes.", "Place scallops in large bowl; pour broth over, Gently toss to coat."]

column2: ["1/2 cup cream cheese (any variety, I love chive and veggie)", "1/2 cup chicken broth", "1 teaspoon butter or 1 teaspoon margarine"]
column3: ["In a large pan, melt all of the butter.", "Add the cream cheese and the chicken broth.", "While stirring the sauce, bring sauce to a boil for a minute.", "Don't burn the sauce!", "Simmer for 2-5 more minutes.", "Serve atop any meal; it's delicious!"]

column2: ["1 cup milk", "2 cups self-rising flour", "1 cup mayonnaise"]
column3: ["Mix the ingredients gently in a bowl with a wooden spoon.", "Dollop dough onto a greased cookie sheet (you should get 12 biscuits out of this recipe).", "Bake at 450 degrees F for 10-12 minutes, or until golden brown."]

column2: ["1 loaf round bread", "1 (8 ounce) package cream cheese, softened", "1/2 cup sour cream", "1/4 cup salsa", "1 1/2 cups shredded cheddar cheese"]
column3: ["Preheat oven to 400 degrees.", "Cut a 1\" slice off the top of the bread. Set aside.", "Remove center of bread, leaving 1/2 inch thick shell. Cut center of bread into cubes and bake until toasted.", "Dip: With electric mixer, beat cream cheese, sour cream and salsa until smooth. Stir in cheddar cheese.", "Spoon mixture into bread bowl, place top onto bread and wrap twice with foil.", "Bake about 1 1/2 hours, or until hot.", "Serve with toasted bread cubes, Tostitos and veggies."]

column2: ["2 teaspoons butter", "2 slices bread", "2 slices bacon, cooked and fat removed", "ketchup"]
column3: ["Butter the bread", "Place buttered side down on toasted sandwich maker.", "Place bacon on top.", "Squirt ketchup on, as much as you like, it gives an excellent taste.", "Top with other piece of bread, buttered side up.", "Toast about 3-4 minutes or until browned."]

column2: ["8 large potatoes", "4 ounces butter, melted", "granulated garlic powder, to taste"]
column3: ["Preheat oven to 400 degrees.", "Cut potatoes length-wise into wedges and place in large bowl.", "Pour melted butter over wedges and stir to coat well.", "Line large baking sheet with aluminum foil.", "Spread butter coated wedges evenly on baking sheet.", "Sprinkle granulated garlic powder over wedges.", "Bake at 400 degrees for 1 hour, or until wedges are done.", "Remove from oven and serve."]

column1: Turkey Cheese Pockets (Or Ham And Cheese Pockets)
column2: ["2 ounces cream cheese, softened", "1 tablespoon mayonnaise or 1 tablespoon Miracle Whip", "1 teaspoon Dijon mustard", "1/2 cup turkey, finely chopped", "1/4 cup mozzarella cheese, shredded", "1 (7 1/2 ounce) can refrigerated biscuits (10 biscuits)"]
column3: ["Preheat oven to 400 degrees (205 celsius).", "Mix cream cheese, mayo, and mustard in a small bowl.", "Add turkey and cheese; mix well and set aside.", "Press or roll out each biscuit to a 3 1/2 inch round.", "Place 1 heaping tablespoon of the cream cheese mixture onto each biscuit round.", "Fold dough over the filling to make a small turnover shape; seal edges by pressing firmly together.", "Place on an ungreased cookie sheet and bake 10 to 12 minutes until lightly browned.", "Serve hot.", "To make ham pockets, replace turkey with chopped ham and mozzarella with shredded cheddar cheese.", "These can be made in advance and frozen for a quick after school snack. Microwave them wrapped in paper towels until hot (1 to 2 minutes)."]

column2: ["1 (8 ounce) package cream cheese, softened", "1 tablespoon mayonnaise", "garlic salt", "1 tomatoes, peeled and chopped", "6 -8 slices bacon"]
column3: ["Blend cream cheese with mayonnaise until smooth.", "Add garlic salt and tomato.", "Cook bacon until crispy; drain and crumble.", "Add bacon to cream cheese mixture when ready to serve.", "Serve as spread with party rye rounds or as a dip.", "Thin with a little milk if necessary."]

column2: ["4 small boneless skinless chicken breasts", "1/2 cup ranch dressing", "2 tablespoons flour", "1/2 cup cheddar cheese"]
column3: ["Rinse and pat dry chicken breasts.", "In a small dish or on a plate, combine the Ranch dressing and the flour. Dip each breast in the mixture until well coated.", "Transfer to baking dish. Cover breasts with the cheddar cheese and bake at 350\u00b0F for 35 minutes or until cooked through."]

column2: ["7 medium potatoes, cut into 1/2-inch cubes", "1/4 cup butter, cubed", "1 cup sour cream", "1 (1 ounce) envelope ranch dressing mix", "1 cup cheddar cheese, shredded"]
column3: ["Place potatoes in a greased 11-inch by 7-inch baking dish; dot with butter.", "Cover and bake at 325 degrees for 60-65 minutes or until tender.", "Combine sour cream and salad dressing mix; spoon over potatoes.", "Sprinkle with cheese.", "Bake, uncovered, for 5-10 minutes or until cheese is melted."]

column2: ["4 boneless skinless chicken breasts", "1 (16 ounce) jar salsa (your choice of heat)", "1 (12 ounce) can Diet Coke (DO NOT SUBSTITUTE ON THIS ITEM)", "1 lime, juice of, fresh squeezed"]
column3: ["In 12 inch skillet, cook chicken over medium high heat in UNSEASONED pan (do NOT spray with PAM or add any oil or butter).", "Sprinkle lightly with salt and pepper to taste.", "Chicken will stick a bit to skillet when turning but that is ok.", "Cook till just brown- you want a bit of color.", "Add the entire jar of Salsa and the can of Diet Coke.", "Reduce heat to medium low- and simmer for approximately 15-20 minutes, covered.", "Remove lid, turn chicken and continue to simmer until sauce has thickened to desired consistency.", "When ready to serve, squeeze juice from 1 fresh lime over the chicken.", "I serve this over yellow rice (I just add turmeric to my rice when cooking- adds nice bright yellow color!).", "Do not use regular Coke as this will turn out too sweet.", "I promise--you cannot taste the Diet Coke."]

column2: ["6 -8 portabella mushrooms", "4 tablespoons butter", "8 ounces cream cheese (softened)", "4 -5 slices bacon, cooked until crisp, cooled and crumbled", "1/2 cup grated mozzarella cheese (or Cheese of your choice)"]
column3: ["Saute mushrooms in 4 T butter for about 5 minutes, save remaining butter (in saute pan).", "Place caps in an oven-proof dish.", "Mix Cream Cheese and Bacon and top mushroom caps, heaping the mix a little.", "Top with grated cheese. Pour remaining butter (from saute pan) around mushrooms and bake for about 8-12 minutes at 375 degrees. Cheese on tops should be melted.", "Best when served warm."]

column2: ["1 lb sliced bacon", "2 1/2 cups shredded cheddar cheese", "2 tablespoons prepared mustard", "1 cup mayonnaise", "1 lb sliced pumpernickel cocktail bread"]
column3: ["Cook bacon crumble and set aside.", "In med.", "bowl combine bacon cheese mustard and mayo.", "Stir well.", "Arrange bread on cookie sheet.", "Spoon mixture on to each slice of bread.", "Place under preheated broiler for 5 minutes until bubbly."]

column1: Simple Batter For Fish Or Veggies
column2: ["1 cup flour", "1 cup milk", "1 egg"]
column3: ["Mix all ingredients together.", "Dip food into batter and fry as desired."]

column2: ["6 -8 medium potatoes (cut into large chunks)", "25 g butter", "2 tablespoons soy sauce"]
column3: ["In a microwave safe dish melt the butter.", "Mix in the soy sauce.", "Add potatoes and toss gently to coat.", "Cover dish with a paper towel.", "Cook on High for 8 minutes.", "Turn and cook on high for a further 8 minutes.", "Remove and stand 2mins before serving."]

column2: ["6 potatoes, baked with skin left on", "1/2 cup butter", "1 cup chopped onion", "garlic salt"]
column3: ["Melt 2 Tbl. butter in skillet on medium heat and cook the onions until just soft.", "Add the potatoes that have been cut into small chunks,garlic salt and pepper to taste and another 2 tbl. butter. Cook on medium heat browning slowly and adding butter 2 tbl. at a time until browned.", "It should take approximately 30 minutes to make these depending on your stove and amount of spuds you use."]

column2: ["1 cup mayonnaise", "1 cup sour cream", "1 (1 ounce) envelope ranch dressing mix", "1 (10 ounce) package of chopped spinach, thawed and drained well"]
column3: ["Mix all ingredients and chill."]

column2: ["2 lbs potatoes", "3 tablespoons butter", "3 tablespoons flour", "2 1/2 cups milk", "1/4 cup onion"]
column3: ["Thinly slice potatoes, cover with cold water and set aside.", "In medium saucepan, melt butter. Stir in flour until no lumps remain, add milk and whisk until combined.", "Cook milk and flour mixture until thick enough to coat the back of a spoon.", "Grease a 2 qt casserole dish.", "layer 1/3 sliced potatoes.", "1/2 of onion.", "1/3 white sauce.", "Repeat layers, finishing up with potatoes and sauce.", "Dot with butter.", "Cover and bake 30 minutes at 350 degrees.", "Uncover and back an additional 1 hour."]

column2: ["2 cups self-rising flour", "1 cup butter, melted", "1 cup sour cream", "1 cup shredded cheddar cheese (I prefer sharp cheddar or pepper jack, 4 ounces)"]
column3: ["Preheat oven to 350 F.", "Combine all ingredients, in a large bowl, until just blended.", "Drop by rounded tablespoonfulls onto lightly greased baking sheet.", "Bake for 20-25 minutes or until golden brown.", "Now grab that bowl of chili, soup, or stew and enjoy!"]

column2: ["4 slices bacon", "4 boneless chicken breasts", "4 cups frozen diced potatoes (with peppers and onions)", "1 cup cheddar cheese"]
column3: ["Cook bacon on medium heat 5 minutes or until crisp. Remove to a paper towel to drain and discard bacon drippings.", "Add chicken to skillet; cook 5 minutes on each side or until done(juices run clear). Remove chicken from skillet and cover to keep warm.", "Crumble bacon and add to skillet with potatoes. Cook and stir 5 minutes or until heated through.", "Place chicken over potatoes; top with cheese; cover and cook 2 minutes or until cheese is melted."]

column2: ["1 slice bread", "1 large egg", "2 slices bacon"]
column3: ["Fry the bacon in your skillet.", "Meanwhile cut or tear out a circle", "(I use a biscuit cutter) in the center of the bread. When the bacon is.", "done remove it from the pan and place the bread in the pan.", "Crack the egg into the hole you created in the bread. Place the cut out portion in the pan to toast.", "Fry egg to your liking, turn over the cut out portion to brown the other side.", "The egg and bread can either be turned for a few seconds or left as sunny side up.", "Serve with the bacon.", "For some reason kids love this simple breakfast -- might be the name."]

column2: ["1/2 cup butter, softened", "1/2 cup cream cheese, softened", "1 cup all-purpose flour"]
column3: ["Beat butter and cream cheese in a bowl until smooth. Add flour; beat just until a soft dough forms. Form into a ball and wrap in plastic wrap; chill for 1 hour or overnight.", "Preheat oven to 425 degrees F/220\u00b0C.", "Shape dough into 1\"/2.5 cm balls. Place each ball of dough into cups of mini muffin pan. Dip Mini-Tart Shaper into flour; press into dough to form tart shells. Pierce shells with a fork. (If you don't have a Mini-Tart shaper just use your fingers and form into shells).", "Bake 10-12 minutes or until light golden brown. Cool in pan for 5 minutes; carefully remove tart shells from pan. Cool completely. Fill as desired."]

column2: ["1 large egg", "1 slice bread (your favorite)", "2 teaspoons butter"]
column3: ["Lay bread on the counter or a plate.", "Using a wide topped glass, cut a circle out of the center of the bread.", "Over medium heat, melt 1 tsp butter in a non-stick skillet.", "When heated, lay both pieces of bread (the circle and the piece with the hole) in pan and reduce heat to low-medium.", "When bread is very lightly browned on the bottom, drop 1 tsp butter into the hole.", "When melted, crack the egg over the hole and allow egg to drop into and fill the hole.", "Cook for 1- 2 minutes and then flip the bread with the egg and the bread circle over.", "Cook for about 2- 3 minutes, until bread is lightly browned and egg is set.", "Serve egg with the toasted bread circle for dipping."]

column2: ["3 tablespoons butter or 3 tablespoons margarine", "1 1/2 lbs thin-skinned potatoes, scrubbed and cut into 1/2 inch cubes", "2 tablespoons soy sauce"]
column3: ["Heat oven to 450.", "Place butter in a 13x9 or 10x15 rimmed baking pan; set pan in oven until butter is melted.", "Add potatoes to pan and stir to coat with butter.", "Bake stirring occasionally, until potatoes are tender when pierced (about 20 minutes).", "Add soy sauce to potatoes and stir to coat.", "Continue to bake until potatoes look dry (about 10 more minutes).", "Good served with beef roast or steak."]

column2: ["2 tablespoons rice", "2 carrots", "1 teaspoon butter"]
column3: ["Simmer in water until rice is very soft.", "Remove and add butter.", "Blend or mash accordind to your baby's age."]

column1: Vegan Dlt (Dulse, Lettuce, And Tomato) Sandwiches
column2: ["4 slices whole-grain bread", "4 tablespoons vegan mayonnaise (vegenaise)", "1/2 cup dulse seaweed", "1 tomatoes", "1/2 cup lettuce"]
column3: ["Dry fry the dulse in a skillet over medium heat for a few minutes, until the leaves turn greenish (black=burnt). Let cool.", "Meanwhile, toast bread (if desired) and slice tomato. Spread bread with vegenaise. Top with dulse, lettuce, and tomato. If desired, season with salt and pepper."]

column2: ["1/2 cup butter, softened", "1 (4 ounce) package cream cheese, softened", "1 cup sifted all-purpose flour"]
column3: ["DAY BEFORE:", "Cream butter and cream cheese together until smoothly blended.", "Beat in the flour.", "Shape dough into a smooth ball; wrap in foil or cling wrap, and refrigerate overnight or up to a week.", "AT BAKING TIME:", "Remove dough from refrigerator 30 minutes before using.", "Start heating oven to 375 degrees Fahrenheit.", "Roll chilled dough thin.", "Cut with 3 or 4 inch round cookie cutter.", "Place small spoonful of filling in center of each round, moisten edges with water.", "Fold round over and press edges together.", "Bake on ungreased cookie sheet 15 to 20 minutes."]

column2: ["5 cups all-purpose flour or 5 cups buttermilk biscuit mix", "1 cup cheddar cheese, shredded", "1 (14 ounce) can chicken broth with roasted garlic"]
column3: ["Heat oven to 450\u00b0F.", "Mix together flour or biscuit mix, cheese and the broth.", "Form into softened dough.", "Drop dough by large spoonfuls upon ungreased baking sheets.", "Bake 10 minutes or until golden.", "Serve warm, enjoy!"]

column2: ["1/2 cup butter, melted", "4 garlic cloves, minced", "1 loaf French bread, halved lengthwise"]
column3: ["In small bowl, combine butter and garlic.", "Brush on cut sides of bread.", "Place on baking sheet.", "Bake at 375\u00b0 for 8 minutes.", "Broil for 2 minutes to brown.", "Cut into thick slices."]

column2: ["1/2 cup salsa", "1/2 cup sour cream", "1 cup grated cheddar cheese"]
column3: ["Heat oven to to 200C.", "In an ovenproof dish layer the salsa first, sour cream and then top with the cheese.", "Bake for 10 mins until cheese is gooey."]

column2: ["2 2 pieces sourdough bread or 2 pieces potato bread", "3 slices cheddar cheese (Tillamook or your favorite, but Tillamook is so darned good! Real Cheddar from England would be acc)", "2 tablespoons butter"]
column3: ["Cut the slices of cheddar cheese; not too thick, but not skimpy, either; cut one slice in half.", "Take the two slices of bread and generously butter each of them on one side.", "Heat up a cast iron skillet over medium heat.", "Get yourself the cover from a Revereware saucepan, or another cover of about the same size.", "Place one of the slices of bread, butter side down, in the hot skillet.", "Spread 2 and a half slices of cheese on the bread, then cover it butter-side-up with the other slice of bread; eat the extra, unused half of the cheese slice.", "Push the bread down a little with the metal spatula, then cover the whole thing up with the saucepan lid (the idea is to heat the air up underneath the lid and melt the cheese faster as you're also browning the bread).", "Uncover every minute and check the cooking bread color- you want it golden, not burnt (no matter what Mom says - she likes 'em black for some reason).", "When it's to the color you like, carefully flip the sandwich over, press down on it with the spatula to squish the bread and cheese together, and re-cover with the saucepan to continue melting the cheese.", "After about 3-5 minutes of slow cooking, you'll have a wonderfully golden, melty, gooey grilled cheese sandwich!"]

column2: ["1 (20 ounce) package cheese tortellini", "1 lb bacon", "1 pint cherry tomatoes", "1 (8 ounce) package cheddar cheese, shredded", "1 cup ranch dressing (more may be used according to personal preference)"]
column3: ["Slice bacon into thin strips (1/2 - 1 inches in width). Separate slices and place into a preheated frying pan.", "While bacon is browning, prepare the tortellini's according to the package's directions. When the tortellini's are fully cooked, run under cool water, drain, and set aside to cool.", "When the bacon is fully cooked, carefully drain the grease and spread the bacon pieces onto paper towels to remove excess grease. Set aside to cool.", "Slice the tomatoes in half.", "In a large bowl, combine the tortellini's, bacon, tomatoes, cheese and ranch dressing. Stir to combine.", "Cover and refrigerate at least one hour, but as much as 2 days.", "When ready to serve, you may add the extra ranch dressing if you wish."]

column2: ["2 cups dry milk", "1 cup flour", "1 cup butter"]
column3: ["Combine with pastry blender until it is the consistency of coarse corn meal.", "Store in airtight jars in refrigerator.", "Makes about 2 quarts medium sauce.", "TO USE:", "Measure mix into sauce pan; add water and cook until thickened, adding seasonings as desired.", "For each 1 cup water, use:", "Thin sauce: 1/4 c mix.", "Medium sauce: 1/2 c mix.", "Thick sauce: 3/4 c mix."]

column2: ["1 -6 egg (Depending on your preference)", "2 slices cheddar cheese", "1 tablespoon butter"]
column3: ["Slice the cheese into tiny squares.", "Crack the eggs into a bowl and mash them up with a fork.", "(Be sure to wash the fork to prevent raw egg poisoning.) Put the butter on a pan on a stove-top set on high.", "Let it melt and move it around until it covers the entire pan.", "Pour the cheese and the eggs into the pan, and using a fork or something else, spread the eggs around, never letting them stay in one space too long.", "Take the eggs out when you desire according to wether you like them hard or soft.", "Enjoy."]

column2: ["2 cups self-rising flour", "1 cup milk", "4 tablespoons mayonnaise"]
column3: ["Preheat the oven to 350 degrees.", "Lightly grease a muffin tin.", "Combine all ingredients well so that the dough is smooth.", "Drop the dough by spoonfuls into the muffin tins.", "Bake in the preheated oven approx.", "30 minutes or until biscuits are done."]

column2: ["1 (8 ounce) package cream cheese, softened", "1/2 cup butter", "1 cup self-rising flour"]
column3: ["Beat the cream cheese and butter until creamy. Gradually, add the flour, beating at low speed just until blended.", "Cover and refrigerate up to three days.", "TO BAKE: Preheat the oven to 400 degrees. Lightly spray a muffin tin and fill with 2/3 full. Bake 17 minutes or until golden."]

column2: ["1 lb fresh mushrooms (cremini or white button mushrooms)", "1/2 cup butter, melted", "1 (1 ounce) envelope ranch dressing mix"]
column3: ["Put mushrooms in a crock pot.", "Mix melted butter with ranch dressing mix. Pour over the mushrooms & cook on low 3 to 4 hours.", "The ranch and butter mixture will look like it will not coat all the mushrooms at first. Let them cook a little and the mushrooms will give off some juice. If not, add just a little water. Enjoy!"]

column2: ["6 -7 large idaho potatoes", "1 medium onion, chopped to preference", "1/2 cup butter or 1/2 cup margarine", "1 cup of preferred milk"]
column3: ["Preheat oven to 400\u00b0.", "Peel skin off potatoes.", "Slice potatoes into thin potato chip like pieces.", "Layer potatoes at bottom of small casserole baking dish until bottom of dish is covered.", "Sprinkle with chopped onion.", "Cut butter into thin slices and lay about five slices (spread out) over the onion and potatoes.", "Repeat last three steps and continue layering potatoes, onion and butter until 3/4 of dish is full.", "Add a cup of milk.", "Bake at 400\u00b0F for approx 45 minute or until potatoes are tender and desired brownness."]

column1: Super Easy Microwave Cheese Sauce For Lasagna
column2: ["90 g butter", "1/3 cup plain flour", "1 3/4 cups milk", "225 g cheddar cheese, grated (or use the whole 250g block)"]
column3: ["Melt butter for 40 secs on high.", "Stir in flour & cook for 1 min on high.", "Gradually stir in milk.", "Cook for 4-6 mins on high, stirring every minute.", "Stir in cheese."]

column2: ["1 cup salsa", "1 cucumber", "1/2 cup fat-free cheddar cheese, shredded", "1/2 cup fat free sour cream"]
column3: ["Put the salsa in a strainer to remove some of the liquid.", "Peel and slice the cucumber.", "Put the slices of cucumber into the bottom of a 9x13 pan, without overlapping.", "Discard the extra salsa liquid.", "Put about 1 teaspoons of salsa on each cucumber slice.", "Sprinkle the tops of the cucumbers with the cheese.", "Put about 1 teaspoons of sour cream on top of each slice.", "Serve cold."]

column2: ["8 ounces cream cheese, softened", "12 -15 sun-dried tomatoes packed in oil, drained reserving 1 T oil", "2 -3 garlic cloves"]
column3: ["Put the cream cheese, tomatoes, garlic and 1 T oil in a blender.", "Process just until the ingredients are blended, but not creamy as there should still be some small pieces of sun-dried tomatoes in the dip.", "Serve with assorted vegetables, chips, crackers or seafood."]

column2: ["2 cups self-rising flour", "1 cup butter, melted", "1/2 pint sour cream"]
column3: ["Preheat oven to 350 degrees", "Combine all ingredients in a bowl and spoon into 24 small or 12 large un-greased muffin tins. Bake for 20 to 30 minutes."]

column2: ["8 ounces butter, melted", "2 cups self-rising flour", "1 cup sour cream"]
column3: ["Preheat oven to 350\u00b0F.", "Mix butter, flour and sour cream until JUST blended. Do Not Over mix.", "Pour batter into muffin tins, 2/3 the way full to allow for biscuits to rise.", "Bake for 20 minutes."]

column1: Baked Scallops With Cheddar Cheese And Applewood Smoked Bacon
column2: ["8 ounces premium sea scallops (Dry works best)", "2 ounces cheddar cheese", "2 ounces applewood smoked bacon, cooked", "1 ounce butter"]
column3: ["Take 2 small casserole dishes and place scallops and butter in them, divide equally. Place in 450 degree oven for 8-10 min or until scallops have slightly blistered. Remove from oven and drain butter and any excess juices. Top with cooked bacon and cheese and place back in oven for 2 minutesor until cheese has melted.", "Enjoy!"]

column2: ["1 slices bacon, cooked, and crumbled (I use the cooked bacon, just a preference thing) or (3 ounce) can bacon bits (I use the cooked bacon, just a preference thing)", "1 cup sour cream", "1 cup mayonnaise", "3 plum tomatoes, seeded & chopped"]
column3: ["Combine all ingredients in bowl.", "Stir until blended.", "Cover and refrigerate 1 hour to blend flavors.", "(This recipe may be prepared up to 3 hours ahead of time)."]

column2: ["1/3 cup mayonnaise", "3 cups self-rising flour (MUST be self-rising)", "1 1/2 cups milk"]
column3: ["Combine all the ingredients and mix well.", "Spray a muffin pan with non-stick cooking spray and pour batter evenly into the cups.", "Bake for 12-15 minutes at 425 F or until dough rises and turns golden brown."]

column2: ["1 (3 ounce) package cream cheese (softened)", "1/2 cup butter", "1 cup flour"]
column3: ["Blend cream cheese and butter together.", "Add flour and mix.", "Chill for at least 30 minutes.", "Divide into 24 balls and press into miniature muffin tins, pushing dough up the sides.", "Spoon filling into pastry shells.", "Bake at 325 degrees Fahrenheit for 25 minutes."]

column2: ["2 chicken breasts, bone in and skin on (Can also use thighs.)", "1 stalk celery, thickly sliced", "3 carrots, peeled, thickly chopped", "2 potatoes, small, peeled and cubed", "2 cups rice, white, uncooked"]
column3: ["Place chicken in a large pot and cover with about 5 cups of water. (An additional cup or so might become necessary during cooking process.).", "Bring to boil; reduce heat, cover and simmer gently for about 30 minutes. Add carrots, celery and potatoes. Cover and continue simmering for another 30 minutes, until chicken is tender.", "Remove chicken pieces from the pot, being careful to remove all bones from the pot as well. Remove meat from bones. Discard bones and return chicken pieces to the pot. (You may either discard the fat or cut it up and return it to the pot with the chicken meat.).", "Stir rice into the simmering pot. Cover and allow to cook for about 20 minutes or until rice is tender and most of the liquid is absorbed.", "Remove from heat. Stir well and let cool completely.", "Package into meal-size portions. Freeze or refrigerate."]

column2: ["3 chicken breasts, cooked & shredded", "3/4 cup hot sauce", "16 ounces cream cheese", "1 cup ranch dressing", "1 1/2 cups cheddar cheese, shredded or 1 1/2 cups Velveeta cheese, cubed"]
column3: ["Heat chicken and hot sauce over medium heat.", "Stir in cream cheese and ranch dressing. Continue cooking and stirring, until the cream cheese is melted.", "Mix in the cheddar cheese (or Velveeta), heating and stirring until it is melted.", "Set aside to cool.", "Freezing Directions:.", "Put dip in rigid container(s) or freezer bag(s) based on how you will serve it: single servings as a snack, or all of it in one container/bag for a group/family serving. Seal, label and freeze.", "Serving Directions:.", "Thaw dip in the refrigerator.", "Heat in the microwave until hot and bubbly.", "Serve with tortilla chips or Ritz crackers. OR for a group or party, put the warmed dip in a slow cooker on low to keep it warm."]

column1: Single Serving Baked Bacon, Egg And Cheese
column2: ["1 slice bacon", "1 teaspoon butter, melted", "1 large egg", "1/4 slice cheddar cheese (or your favorite)"]
column3: ["Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F.", "If making one: Cook the bacon in a skillet over medium-high heat until browned but still flexible.", "If making more than one: Lay out bacon on a foil and parchment-lined cookie sheet. Bake in the 350 degree F oven for 10 to 12 minutes. (You want the bacon to be cooked and flexible; not crispy.) Or cook in a skillet over medium-high heat until browned but still flexible.", "Set up ramekins (4-ounce) or you can use a muffin tin. But if you are using the ramekins, place them on a cookie sheet.
